brief: Develop a robust API for real-time fraud detection in transactions.
business_problem: Financial institutions face increasing fraud risks, jeopardizing customer trust and revenue. A swift, reliable detection system is crucial to mitigate losses and enhance security.
target_users: Fraud analysts and transaction monitoring teams in financial institutions
goals: Design a scalable API for transaction data ingestion
Create comprehensive logging for audit and analysis
deliverables: Fully functional RESTful API with documentation
Fraud detection model integrated with the API
assessment_criteria: API performance under load, accuracy of fraud detection, and code maintainability

user_stories.title: Ingest transaction data
user_stories.description: As a fraud analyst, I want to ingest transaction data in real-time so I can monitor for suspicious activities immediately.
acceptance_criteria: Given the API is running, when I send a transaction payload, it is processed within 200 milliseconds.
The system logs each transaction with a unique identifier for tracking.
Ingestion supports batch processing of up to 100 transactions at once.

user_stories.title: Detect fraudulent transactions
user_stories.description: As a fraud analyst, I want to receive alerts for potentially fraudulent transactions so I can take immediate action.
acceptance_criteria: Given a transaction is processed, when it meets fraud criteria, an alert is generated within 1 second.
Alerts include transaction details and risk score for prioritization.
The system allows configuration of fraud detection parameters.

user_stories.title: Audit transaction logs
user_stories.description: As a compliance officer, I want to audit transaction logs so I can ensure regulatory compliance.
acceptance_criteria: Given I access the logging endpoint, I can retrieve logs for any date range.
Logs include transaction details, processing time, and fraud detection outcomes.
The system supports exporting logs in CSV format for external analysis.
